properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 12 at 10:09AM CST until February 12 at 12:15PM CST by NWS Shreveport LA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a

* Urban and Small Stream Flood Advisory for Poor Drainage Areas
for...
Northwestern Miller County in southwestern Arkansas...
East central Bowie County in northeastern Texas...

* Until 1215 PM CST.

* At 1008 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain that will cause
urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas
will result in minor flooding in the advisory area. Between one to
two inches of rain have already fallen since midnight.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Texarkana, Wake Village, Nash, Red Lick, Mandeville and Genoa.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you
can do so safely.

A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding
of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
